# Ray Howard

| birth_place       = Rochester, New York, U.S.
| death_date        =
| death_place       = near Butler, Indiana, U.S.
| module1 =
}}
Ray L. Howard (August 2, 1891 â€“ January 29, 1957) was an American racing driver. Howard made three Championship Car starts in 1919 - the 1919 Indianapolis 500 and two races on the Sheepshead Bay Race Track board oval in June of that year driving a Peugeot. He then drove a Peugeot in the 1920 Indianapolis 500. His final start came on the Uniontown Speedway board oval in 1922 driving a Ford and suffering a broken frame on lap 2.
In his later life he lived in Toledo, Ohio, working as an engineer for Dana. He died of a heart attack while on the road near Butler, Indiana.
